#Text=Cleo and Dolly merger leaves senior Australian Cleo editor Sharri Markson out of work
#Text=Friday , November 8 , 2013
#Text=Logo Bauer Media Group
#Text=Senior Editor for Australia ' s Cleo magazine Sharri Markson confirmed on Wednesday that she will not be competing for the role of editor between the sudden merger of Dolly and Cleo titles .

#Text=The news came only days after German -based Bauer Media announced the merger of two of their most popular Australian magazines , with an expected loss of half the production staff by early next year .
#Text=The production team was informed of the merge in a staff meeting on Monday .

#Text=Chief executive Matt Stanton and publisher Sebastian Kadas explained the merger process , which will see the separate mastheads continue under the one production team and half the size of the normal magazine printing dimensions .

#Text=Both current editors Sharri Markson and Tiffany Dunk , along with the entire production team , were required to re-apply for their positions and compete against one another to secure a position .

#Text=However , according to The Australian , after only three days of consideration , Markson informed staff that she is not prepared to accept the role given it would mean producing two magazines with half the staff .
#Text=Former editors of both Dolly and Cleo are turning to Twitter to show support for the staff in danger of unemployment .
#Text=Mia Freedman
#Text=posted ; " Sad for all the girls who dream of working in magazines .

#Text= I just hope the magazine publishers in this country have been mentoring that new talent otherwise it simply will not work " .

column1: #Text=Bauer Media have released a statement addressing the situation , claiming to be “ continually reviewing every aspect of its business , looking at new opportunities for growth and investment , whilst ensuring all divisions are working as efficiently and effectively as possible ” .
#Text=Bauer ’s CEO who addressed the staff on Monday continued , saying " it makes sense to bring the staff creating these young women ’s lifestyle titles together .
